data.title: Dishes not well presented
data.text: Was hard for me to distinguish the names of the dishes. Seems like they only had chicken as a meat. The Golub Jamans were enormous and they had a slotted spoon so that you could not get the juice.Took along time to get the waiters attention

data.title: Good Buffet
data.text:
If you plan to go for Indian Buffet, this place is definitely a great place.  Lot of options, including great deserts.  Carrot Halwa is something very close to Indian make.  Tandoori chicken is also fine.  
But this place is definitely not for dinner and alacarte.  Very high priced and not worth it.

data.title: Great lunch buffet
data.text:
This place has a great lunch buffet. They have several types of fresh salad, about 6-8 kinds of main dishes, garlic naan, rice, chutney, different kinds of pickles, mango ice cream, chickpeas, aloo gobi, chicken curry, chicken tikka masala, and a rotation of different main dishes.

Everything is quite good and it is an exceptional value for an all you can eat buffet.

data.title: Great Indian Food Delivered!
data.text: We were staying in an Anaheim hotel and ordered Tandoori Garden for delivery. Service was quick and friendly and I even had to add to my order after I paid online. Would really recommend this restaurant and the garlic naan is phenomenal.

data.title: One of the best Indian food buffet in the county.
data.text:
Let me keep it simple. Super awesome chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, awesome daal, and gulab Jamun. 
This also has the best Indian buffet. To choose from.

data.title: Good Food and Service
data.text:
While spending a week in the area, I was looking for something other than the usual American fare in terms of food.  A family member suggested Indian.  Based on a Trip Advisor search and reviews, I found Tandoori Garden.  Not being the Indian food expert, we relied on the recommendations.  The result was that we had a good dinner at a very quaint restaurant!  From being greeted at the door through to our dinner and beyond, the service was prompt, friendly, expedient, and attentive.  The food was brought out quickly, hot and well displayed.  From my limited experience with Indian food, I would say the taste was quite good!  From others in my party more experienced,  they seemed pleased, and had only good compliments all around.  

I would definitely return, and expand my knowledge and taste buds here!  May have to think about coming back on my birthday, when they offer a free dinner and dessert!

data.title: Authentic Indian Food
data.text:
I'm visiting from India & had opportunity to visit this lovely Indian restaurant. 
Their Food is Authentic. 
The Vegetarian food was very good, especially Palak & Chana Masala. 
Non Vegetarian Kebab platter could have been better.

data.title: Good food, affordable, ok service
data.text:
I was yelping for places to eat and came across this place. The feedback was above average but one of my friends gave it thumbs up and said he had used a groupon. Being a frugal finder, I was down in trying a place and save $10. 

Upon walking in, we saw the tables occupied by customers of perhaps Indian ethnicity. For me, a good sign! It's like going to a Chinese place and seeing asians inside.

Service is a bit slow and we waited a bit to order. We decided on

Vegetable Samosa 
Chicken Tikka Masala 
Tandoori mahi
Rice, but no naan this visit.

The samosa was hearty and crispy, piping hot and not overly spicy. 

The masala was so creamy and yummy! It wasn't spicy and went perfectly over the rice.

The mahi was tender and had a great flavor, with 4 decent pieces.

We had the kafti and chai for dessert, also delicious! The chai was creamy but not peppery, which I was a bit disappointed. 

Overall a great visit but service could be better.

data.title: Good Delivery Option for Indian Food
data.text:
During Thanksgiving holidays, we stayed at a nearby hotel and wanted to order for Vegetarian Indian Food for dinner. We were tired after Disneyland visit and opted for "Delivery".

This restaurant offers 10% discount and charges $3 for delivery. Delivery time was little longer but worth waiting because of good quality of food. The prices appear to be lower than other Indian Restaurant called Gandhi Palace in Anaheim who offers free delivery, 10% discount but charges almost 22 % higher with lower food quantity. 

We ordered to days for dinner and each day was a good experience. We ordered for 
1 Mushroom Masala ($8.95) , 2 Paneer Tikka Masala ($17.90 for two) , 3 Aloo Paratha ($9.75 for three), 1 Naan Tokri ($6.95), 1 Basmati Boiled Rice ( $ 2.95 for half).  Total bill with taxes and discount was $ 48.67. Food was sufficient for a family of four. Each of the item was very tasty.

data.title: Great place to grab some food after Disney fireworks.
data.text: We arrived late for dinner so had to carry out. Biryani and paneer were really good. Naans were fluffy and fresh as well. Packed well for carry out, not in regular styrofoam boxes. Prices are pretty standard. Waited 20 minutes for our order. So not to bad there either. Would go back again if i am in the area.

data.title: Not as expected
data.text: We were craving for some Indian food and read this review, so we decided to give it a go. The chicken vindaloo was disappointing, not spicy, taste more like tomato sauce chicken. The tandoori chicken was dry and tasteless. The aloo goobi was dry and bland. To put salt on wound, we realized when paying that they served the exact same thing at the buffet line which cost $8.95 for one and we paid $36. The waiter did not tell us that everything we ordered as ala carte was serving at the buffet!

data.title: Good taste but possibly stable bread
data.text: We had a takeout with Paneer tikka masala, daal and naan.  The paneer and daal tasted great but the naan tasted as if it was stale/old dough.  We were visiting Anaheim and got the take-out on a Saturday afternoon (~4 PM).

data.title: Nice but too lightly spiced
data.text:
I ordered the chicken vindaloo delivered to my hotel. The delivery was more than twenty minutes late. The curry was quite tasty although it was not sour as a vindaloo is supposed to be and the spice was so slight I could not really detect anything other than the tomato base. In terms of chilli content I asked for "super extra hot" and it was as hot as I'd expect as a first time customer i.e. enough chilli to notice but nothing like hot enough to induce a sweat.

For me this was too far away from being authentic for me to want to eat from here again. This is mass market toned down Indian food that I expect most people would enjoy.

data.title: Poor service
data.text: We visited January 1 and were disappointed.  We arrive a little after noon and were the only customers.  The staff did seem to be busy with carry-out orders.  It was extremely cold in the retaurant and the staff was not warm either.  They were not serving the lunch buffet even though it was a week day.  We ordered from the menu and were disappointed that we did not get the appetizer sampler that we requested.  We were substituted fish which was less expensive and still charged for the sampler.  The bread was very tastey and the curry was good.  My husband ordered the Mahi-mahi.  It was tasteless.  We will not return.

data.title: garlic naan was the highlight!
data.text: I went here for lunch buffet on friday! upon entering, the place was cozy and nicely decorated! the buffet selection was good, some are spicy enough but tolerable! the chicken tikka masala and chicken tandoori was my favorite in the buffet selection. there was only 1 waiter at that time, but very attentive to everyone! i requested another basket of garlic naan and gave it to me. the desert selection was my favorite part--the sweet rice with almond particulary. the manggo ice cream was good but had a rough taste in it!

data.title: Great Indian Food
data.text: If you want a change from the standard tourist food try this restaurant.  They make several types of Naan bread to go with reasonably priced Indian meals.  We had soup with our meals and had to take food back with us which I reheated for lunch.  Happy with this choice.

data.title: Great buffet...
data.text: Awesome food at buffet....lots of options for both veg & non-veg with 4 choices of dessert. Dined twice in our 5 day trip to LA and both times the food was great...

data.title: Tandoori Garden is serving up authentic North Indian cuisine in Anaheim, CA
data.text:
Mango Lassi is Tandoori Garden’s homemade yogurt blended with imported mango pulp from India, crushed ice, and topped with a few drops of rose water. This is the best mango smoothie you’ll ever have. It was ice cold, creamy, and packed full of mango flavor. Indian mango is very different than Hawaiian mango. It tasted more like a papaya. The color was a vibrant orange like pureed pumpkin. The rose water added a sweet, floral aroma and flavor to the drink. It was a nice touch! Thumbs up, way up!

Garlic Naan is garnished with freshly chopped garlic, coriander leaves, and baked in a clay oven. Slightly crispy outside, yet chewy, it was baked just right. It had an excellent garlic flavor. The coriander leaves were a fresh and flavorful touch. Thumbs up, way up!

Full order of Chicken Tandoori is quartered pieces of young succulent chicken that has been marinated overnight in their signature blend of herbs and spices. The cooks at Tandoori Gardens have learned the art of tandoori very well. This has to be the best tandoori chicken I’ve ever had. The pieces were fall-off-the-bone juicy, even the white meat. The tandoori locked in the flavor and made it juicy and tender, almost like broasted chicken but without the oil. The marinade was subtle but brought out the essence of the chicken. Thumbs up, way up!

Chicken Tikka Masala is boneless chicken cooked in a Tandoor and prepared in a yogurt butter cream sauce. Wow! The chicken absorbed the spices in the sauce which was creamy and light. It looks heavy, but you’ll definitely love it. The sauce reminded me of chipotle cream sauce without the heat. Order a side of basmati rice or naan so you can sop up the sauce. You don’t want to waste a drop as the sauce makes this dish extraordinary. Thumbs up, way up!

Lamb Saag is boneless pieces of tender lamb, cooked in spinach and blended with their signature herbs and spices. This dish is one of my all-time favorites in Indian cuisine and Tandoori Garden makes a really great one. The lamb was so tender like the perfect beef stew, almost melts in your mouth. The spinach was cooked down and with the juices from the lamb and spices and made a lovely gravy-like sauce. Use your naan to scoop it up as you don’t want to waste a drop of this one either. Thumbs up, way up!

data.title: Excellent Indian Food
data.text:
We did takeout twice while we were staying in a hotel near Disneyland. Delivery was prompt and the food was well packaged along with plates and cutlery. All the food we ordered was also excellent, well made and very tasty. Have to especially call out their chicken tikka masala, vegetable korma and vegetable biryani which were all excellent. Their chana masala was the only let down, but was not that bad either. Just not of the same standard as the rest. 
Would definitely order from them again when we travel to LA area.

data.title: Awesomeness !!!!
data.text: I called this place just 5 mins before they were closing and placed an order for 10 people (Take out). But trust me the food was so great and awesome.Everything was packed so neatly with plasticware for 10 people. We like it so much that we placed the same dinner order for next evening.
